title: Beach Games
description: Michael uses "beach day" at Dunder-Mifflin to find out which employee would be his most capable replacement, just in case he receives the promotion to the New York office that he's applied for.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Ughh... Blech.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: OK, where does it hurt?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Just... all over. I don't want to do anything... I'm dying...

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: No, that's not how it works. You have to point to a specific part of the body.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Right there. [Michael points to computer screen.]

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: [reading from screen] "Abdomen. Menses."

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Maybe.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: "The uterus contracts after your egg passes through it."

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Not it. I don't have eggs.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: About 40 times a year, Michael gets really sick, but has no symptoms. Dwight is always gravely concerned.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Oh, is it possible you ate food that contained animal waste?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: That's possible.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Michael?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Uh-huh?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: David Wallace is on line one.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: The CFO? Ohh...

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: OK, everybody out. Out. Out. Out. OK.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: To what do I owe this great honor, David Wallace?

quotes.speaker: David Wallace
quotes.text: [on phone] Michael, I am calling--

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: And Gromit. [David sighs] Jan? Is Jan there?

quotes.speaker: David Wallace
quotes.text: Jan is out of town right now.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Oh, you sigh like Jan. I broke Jan's heart, David, and it was awful. It was... It was never my intention to ruin a life. But you know what? Sometimes...

quotes.speaker: David Wallace
quotes.text: Michael?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: ...you just gots to get your freak on.

quotes.speaker: David Wallace
quotes.text: Michael?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Yeah.

quotes.speaker: David Wallace
quotes.text: Michael?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Hmmm.

quotes.speaker: David Wallace
quotes.text: I am calling to see if you can come down and interview for a job we have opening in corporate.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Really?

quotes.speaker: David Wallace
quotes.text: Week from today. Bring your first quarter stats and your recommendation for who would take over the Scranton Branch.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Wow. I wish I had prepared something to say.

quotes.speaker: David Wallace
quotes.text: That's not necessary.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: May God guide you in your quest.

quotes.speaker: David Wallace
quotes.text: Yes.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: OK, everybody have their towels and swim suits? We have about an hour and half.  I suggest that you all go potty now and then we will be congregating on the partay bus.

quotes.speaker: Meredith
quotes.text: Oh I'm excited. Today is Beach Day! And Michael is taking the whole office to the beach. So I'm wearing my bathing suit underneath my shirt [lifts up shirt, definitely not wearing anything underneath] Oh, yeah... I packed it in my purse.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Oscar, you brought your Speedo, I assume?

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: I don't wear a Speedo, Michael.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Well, you can't swim in leather pants. [laughs] I'm just yankin' your chain.  Not literally.

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.text: Anybody need sun block? Got SPF 30.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Oh, you know what? Uh, you're not going.

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.text: It's Beach Day...

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Yeah, I know. I'm sorry, Toby. We... um... Somebody has to stay here.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I want today to be a beautiful memory... that the staff and I share after I have passed on to New York. And if Toby is a part of it... then it'll suck.

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.text: Hey, want my sun screen?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Oh, great. I forgot mine and I'm wearing a two piece.

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.text: Uh-huh.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Thanks Toby.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Hey Pam, I have a very important job for you

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: I thought we were just having fun at the beach.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: We are. We are. But, I would like you to take notes. And I want you to find out about people's character. Not their hotness, per se, but their humor, and their charisma, and the indefinable quality that makes you all glad to follow me.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: What happens to a company if somebody takes their boss away? I will answer your question with a question. It's like what happens to a chicken when you take its head away. It dies. Unless you find a new head. I need to see which one of these people have the skills to be a chicken head.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: You want me to write down people's indefinable qualities?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I want you to write down everything that people are doing all day. And then type it up, in a way that is helpful. Alright?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: I have the most boring job in the office, so... why wouldn't I have the most boring job on beach day?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: This way to the partay bus.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: I just want to lie on the beach and eat hot dogs. That's all I've ever wanted.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: [singing] [Angela mouthing the words next to him] And the night got deathly quiet, and his face lost all expression. Said, "If you're gonna play the game, boy, ya gotta learn to play it right." [rest of office joins in at varying times] You got to know when to hold 'em, know when to fold 'em, Know when to walk away and know when to run. You never count your money when you're sittin' at the table. There'll be time enough for countin' when the dealin's done.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Everybody, may I have you attention please? Today, we are not just spending a day at the beach.

quotes.speaker: Stanley
quotes.text: Oh, sweet mother of God.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: If you don't like it, Stanley, you can go to the back of the bus.

quotes.speaker: Stanley
quotes.text: Excuse me?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Or the front of the bus. Or drive the bus.  Just, we are all participating in mandatory fun activities.  Funtivities!  And there is a special secret prize for the winner!

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Yes! Funtivities! I knew it wasn't just a trip to the beach.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Okay, you know what? Your enthusiasm's turning people off.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: I hope there will be management parables.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Well, [whispering] Hey Pam, did you get that down?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Like what?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Like everything I said and everything they did and... Just don't...

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Well... no, I don't... exactly... what?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Well write it down before you forget it. That's... You've just been drawing pictures. [sighs] Rrrr. I can't stay mad at you.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Here we are ladies and gentlemen. Everybody ready? Last one down is a rotten egg. [Gets off bus] Watch out for snakes!

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: Everyone put on sunscreen.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Alright, find a cozy spot. Everybody settle in. [everybody sits down on beach] OK, everybody up! Circle 'round. [motions for circle to form] Let us play some games. We are situated on the northeast corner of scenic Lake Scranton. America's eighth largest indigenous body of water. It is here that a group of Americans will undergo the ultimate challenge. One day, 14 strangers who work together, but only one survivor.

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: What?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Just words. Inspiring words. [under breath] Not a contender. [out loud] For the competitions, you will be divided into four tribes. Each tribe will have a leader that I will pick randomly off the top of my head without thinking. Jim, Dwight, Andy and Stanley.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Yes!

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Choose your tribes. Except for Pam. Not Pam.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Jim Halpert. Pros: smart, cool, good-looking. Remind you of anybody you know? Cons: not a hard worker. I can spend all day on a project, and he will finish the same project in a half an hour. So that should tell you something.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: I choose Michael!

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I'm not playing.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: OK, temp.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Dwight is an obvious candidate for my job. He has the best sales record in the office. He loves the work. He is, however, an idiot.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: We are going to choose team names. Dwight?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: We will be called Gryffindor.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Really? Not Slytherin?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Slytherin are the bad guys, Jim.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: I know. Okay, we will be Voldemort.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: He-who-must-not-be-named? I wouldn't do that.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: [starts chanting] Vol-de-mort, Vol-de-mort ...[Kevin and Karen follow] Vol-de-mort! Vol-de-mort! Vol-de-mort!

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: OK, seriously. You really shouldn't be saying that.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Hey, hey, hey. Ok, Ok... Stanley, your team name?

quotes.speaker: Stanley
quotes.text: I don't care what you call my team.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Then I will name your team the Red team.

quotes.speaker: Stanley
quotes.text: No [crosses arms], the blue team.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I am also considering Stanley because of all the good that black people have done. For America.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: We will be team U.S.A.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Very good. Pam, please take a note that Andy is patriotic.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Andy Bernard. Pros: He's classy. He gets me. He went to Cornell. I trust him. Cons: I don't really trust him.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: It is time for the great spoon and egg race. This one is with a little twist.

quotes.speaker: Stanley
quotes.text: There's already a twist, you're carrying an egg on a spoon.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Shh... The person carrying the egg will be blindfolded. Please put on your blindfolds. That person carrying the egg will go down, circle a torch, come back, deposit their egg in the pail. First team back is the winner. Alright. Ready? Set. Go! [contestants start walking]

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: Come on Phyllis, you can do it. [Phyllis' egg falls off spoon] Ahh...

quotes.speaker: Stanley
quotes.text: Thank you so much.  [Stanley sits down and pulls out his crossword puzzle]

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Phyllis is out. Yes! [to Kelly] Follow my voice. Follow my voice. Yeah, keep it moving. Keep it moving. Right this way. Looking good. [Cheers]

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.text: I don't want to hit the big rock!

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Don't worry. You're not...

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.text: I know I'm near the big rock. I just know it.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: No where near the big rock.

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.text: [takes off blindfold] I just don't want to get hit by it...

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: What're you doing? No! See, now we're disqualified.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: I am okay if I lose every single contest today. Honestly. Because I see these contests as an opportunity for me to demonstrate what a good sport I am. Mallard! [throws a stone]

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: [to Karen] Woah, stop, stop, stop. There's a hole. Step over the hole.

quotes.speaker: Karen
quotes.text: Hole?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Yup. [Karen takes a big step] Perfect, oooh, just made it. OK, turn left.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: [to Ryan] Come on!  Come on! Andale! Arriba! Arriba!

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: Can you just stop this right now, or I'm not gonna do this anymore.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: What are you saying?

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: You have to stop yelling at me or I'm not gonna do the egg race.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: OK, I apologize for yelling at you.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: That's what being a good captain is about. It's about listening to the members of your team.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: I am trying to bring team spirit.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: [to Karen] Woah, stop, another hole. Take a big step. [Karen steps into lake] Yes!

quotes.speaker: Karen
quotes.text: [lifts up blindfold] Oh my God! You ass! [chases Jim and throws egg at him] [both laugh]

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: There's nothing better than a beautiful day at the beach, filled with sun, surf, and uh... diligent note-taking. [holds up notes]

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: [off screen] Pam...you're missing things. [shakes off hand and starts writing in notebook]

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: [at Ryan holding egg in spoon] Let's go! Let's go! Come on! Mush! Mush! Come on you bastard! [Ryan takes off blindfold and throws it to ground along with egg and spoon] What the? Damn it temp!

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: [begins to clap] Great job everyone, that was fantastic. [Michael sighs]

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Okay Pam, I have another little project for you.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Does it have to do with these shopping bags filled with hot dogs?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Smart as a whip! Yes! [holds up hot dog packages] These are pre-cooked, so it's not absolutely necessary, but I would appreciate it if you could heat up 800 hot dogs for a little contest I'm going to be having. I would greatly appreciate it.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: When's the contest?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Like umm...[looks at watch] ten minutes?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: How am I supposed to... get...

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Thanks a bunch.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: A good manager has got to be hungry. Hungry for success.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: OK, who's hungry [Kevin starts to put hot dog in mouth] No, no, no. Do not touch the food. Please. Not yet. That is our next event. A hot dog eating contest. [sighs at the table] For those of you who are curious, the world record is 54 and one half hot dogs. Wow! And you know what? I personally have cooked up enough so each and every one of you could break that record. So shoot for the stars, OK? Alright, the team that eats the most hot dogs in ten minutes will be declared the winner. On you mark. Get set.

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.text: Can I have a turkey burger?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: No, I have the only one. I claimed it. Ready?

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: Turkey is a healthy meat.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: It's very good for you. [overlapping talk from all at table]

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Guys, guys, guys. Come on! Pleeeeease... Let's just... OK, it's very important that you all try to eat as many hot dogs as you can. On your mark. Get set. Eat!

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.text: Is there any mustard?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: No mustard, no mustard. Just eat it, eat it, Phyllis. Dip it in the water so it'll slide down your gullet more easily.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Come on, the winner gets a big, big prize.

quotes.speaker: Meredith
quotes.text: [eating hot dog] What is it?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I can't say.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: You can't say, or you can't pronounce it?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: The winner gets a regional manager's salary for a year, and a Sebring, and the feeling that they are making a difference in the world.

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.text: Can we just take those first two things?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: The winner of today gets my job. Ok? I'm interviewing for a job at corporate. And they're only interviewing a handful of people and I'm the most qualified and I'll probably get it. Alright?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: You're leaving?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I didn't want to tell anyway. I didn't want to cast a pall over our fun beach day. But you know what? I don't know who to recommend because frankly nobody is stepping up.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: [slams fist onto table] I am so hungry! [starts eating hot dog real fast]

quotes.speaker: Stanley
quotes.text: Do you expect me to believe that you're truly making your recommendations on this basis?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: [points at Stanley] Word. [Stanley starts eating hot dog] There we go. Let's see it.

quotes.speaker: Stanley
quotes.text: I would rather work for an upturned broom with a bucket for a head than work for somebody else in this office besides myself. Game on!

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Four. Three. Two. One. Stop your eating! And the winner is Andy Bernard, with 14 hot dogs!

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.text: Team U.S.A.!

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: One came up.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: 13 hot dogs, everybody!

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Damn it!

quotes.speaker: Creed
quotes.text: [holding a fish with all the meat stripped off] Nobody told me we were going to have hot dogs!

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Sabotage.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: What? What are you saying? Did you say sandwich?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: No. I was saying that before. Not now.  Now I am saying sabotage. The ancient Dutch art of screwing up your own team.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: I knew you were saying sabotage.  I was giving you an example of it. I will misunderstand everything that Andy says until he goes insane.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: If Michael organizes some kind of group hug, stand next to me.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: It's very simple. There are only three rules. You must not touch the ground. You must not step outside of the ring. And you must always wear the safety mittens.

quotes.speaker: Stanley
quotes.text: Uh, we don't have any safety mittens

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Probably left them in the trunk of my car. It's alright.  It's alright. Here we go.

quotes.speaker: Karen
quotes.text: Get 'em big boy!

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Aaaaaand, go!

quotes.speaker: Karen
quotes.text: C'mon, Jim!

quotes.speaker: Stanley
quotes.text: [growly noises, Jim looks terrified]

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: What are you doing?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Nice, Stanley!

quotes.speaker: Stanley
quotes.text: [to Jim] Sorry about that. It's all about taking points away from Dwight.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Yeah. No. Good.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Oh, my God. I have never seen that look in a man's eyes... ever. I thought that I might die. On beach day.

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: If either of these guys are put in charge of the office I will transfer to Albany. Gil can come if he wants. I'm kinda looking for a way out of that relationship anyway.  I think I might try girls for a while. Angela thinks I can cross over. We'll see.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: [Andy and Dwight sumo wrestle] Gaaaaa....

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: One. Two. Three.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Yaaaaa! Yaaaaa!

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Excellent!

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Gryffindor! Gryffindor!

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: I didn't win. But the only reason I didn't win is because I recently learned that it's better to work thing out with words.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: That's not why you lost.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Yeah it is. I totally could have kicked your butt so bad.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Yeah, right.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Yeah, right, c'mon! C'mon! [Dwight and Andy wrestle]

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: [bouncing off of Andy] Aaaagh! Uggggh! How do you like that?

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: [Trying to wet bandana, falls in water] Oh, God! Waaa! Guhh! Wuuuh! Help! Angela! Angela, hey! Oh, thank God! Please tell somebody!

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: What, Andy?  Andy, what should I tell them?

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Go tell them I'm floating away, obviously!

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: I don't understand what you want from me.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Angela, it's pretty simple! Look at what I'm doing and go tell somebody about it!

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: Sorry! Bye, Andy!

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Angela!

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I knew that finding a successor would be difficult. I did not know that it would be impossible. Thus far the candidates have been wildly disappointing. Uh, Jim is not taking it seriously. Uh, Stanley is having a stroke. And Andy, where is he? Where the hell is Andy? Where is he, Pam? Do you know? Ah... who's ahead in points?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: I think they're even. At various times you gave Jim ten points, Dwight a gold star, and Stanley a thumbs up. And I don't really know how to compare those units.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Check to see if there is a conversion chart in that notebook.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: I really doubt it, Michael.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Please just check.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: [on cell phone] Great. Yeah, I'll see you next week. Thank you, and here is Karen Filipelli. Bye.

quotes.speaker: Karen
quotes.text: Hello?  Yeah, hi David. Yes, I would like to be considered for the corporate position in well.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: In well?

quotes.speaker: Karen
quotes.text: As well.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: How would that work in well?  I just want to know.

quotes.speaker: Karen
quotes.text: Yes. uh, huh.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Wait a minute.

quotes.speaker: Karen
quotes.text: That would be fine.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: If this job is in a well, I don't want it.

quotes.speaker: Karen
quotes.text: [whispering] Cut it out!

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: I don't!

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: What does a great manager need most of all? Courage.

quotes.speaker: Stanley
quotes.text: How so? I mean... sure thing, that sounds smart... I can't do this anymore! I'm goin' to sit in the bus.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Your loss, Stanley. Meanwhile the rest of us will have a super fun time defeating our fear and creating a lasting memory. Walking through FIRE!

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Who among you has the guts to replace me? Let him walk across these coals.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: Are you going to try it?

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: I'm not going to talk through the fire after your disgusting feet have gone through.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: Angela, it is a million degrees.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: I'm gonna do it. And I fully expect to burn my feet and go to the hospital. That's the right spirit when doing a coal walk, right?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: No. No, not you, Pam. You have to keep score.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: I'd like to try it.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Pointless.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: But I'm not kidding.  I really want to do it.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Blah, blah, blee blup, blup, okay? This is about guts. It takes guts to be a regional manager. Jim, you're up.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Nope.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Ji.. why not? C'mon.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Oh, 'cause I don't want my feet to get burned.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: You do not have what it takes to be a regional manager.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: That's harsh.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Who's next? Andy? Where's Andy? Andy is never here today.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: [lying in water, car lights light up his location] Hello?  Who's there?  My name is Andrew Bernard, I was with a group called Dunder Mifflin.  Hello?

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: Why don't you go Michael?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Because I already did. Remember? I burned my foot on a George Foreman grill.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: And that is not the same at all. If you're going to ask other people to do it, you should do it yourself.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Alright. Okay. Alright. Fine. 'kay. [clears throat, breathes noisily] The mind has to wrap around the foot. [exhales] Okay.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Do you want us to count to three?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Yes. Count to three, please.

quotes.speaker: Group
quotes.text: Three. Two. One.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Count the other way. Count... no, no, count one, two, three, not three, two, one.

quotes.speaker: Group
quotes.text: One. Two. Three!  Go! Do it!  Go, Michael.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Wait! Am I going on go? Or am I going on three?

quotes.speaker: Creed
quotes.text: On the go that's after three.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Okay.

quotes.speaker: Group
quotes.text: One, two, three, go!

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: No! It's okay. I will do this Michael.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Don't, don't.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: [walking on coals] I will walk and stand on these coals until you award me the position of regional manager!

quotes.speaker: Group
quotes.text: Wow. Go, Dwight. Keep moving.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: [standing still, on the coals] GIVE ME THE JOB!  GIVE ME THE JOB!

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I'm not going to give it to you.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: [falling on his knees, then on all fours] Aaagh, aaagh!

quotes.speaker: Group
quotes.text: [yelling excitedly for Dwight to get off the coals]

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Michael, do something!

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Aggggh, that stings!

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Being the boss is also about image.  I've never looked like that. That was gross. I just, I don't see the connection between a firewalk and management. Worst seventy-five bucks I ever spent. You know what, if I had to pick my replacement based on today, it would be Mr. "Outside Hire."

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: Or Mrs. "Outside Hire."

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Yeah.  Ummm, hmm... True.  Look, I don't want to leave this branch that I love to an outside hire therefore we are going to have a one hundred point winner take all sudden death tribal council round. To test the aspect of my job that I think is the most important, something I call the Bob Hope factor.

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.text: Who's Bob Hope?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: God! He's a comedian.

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.text: Oh, like Amanda Bynes.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Who's Amanda Bynes?

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.text: She's from "What a Girl Wants."

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Oh, I love that movie. Yes, Kelly is right, the person to replace me has to have a great sense of humor and they have to possess the leadership qualities of a Bynes or a Hope.  So without further ado, Jim and Dwight show us what you got.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Hey, I know what you're looking for, but um, I got to be honest, I really don't think I should be considered as your replacement.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: You are being too modest.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Michael, on Thursday I'm going to drive down and interview with David for the open position in New York.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Hhhh... okay. That is not funny. I am deducting sixty points from Voldemort for false pretenses. Okay, Dwight your turn. Wow us.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: The Aristocrats. A man and his wife and his children go into the offices of a talent agency. And the talent agent says, "Describe your act." And the man says something really, really raunchy and the talent representative says, "What do you call yourselves?" And the man says, "The Aristocrats!"

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: [breathes deeply and runs across coals] Oooh, uh hah, ooh! Wha-hoo! Ahhhh...

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: [finishes story] I mean truly repulsive acts.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: That is a very, very funny story.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: [runs over after walking over fire coals] Hey! I want to say something. I've been trying to be more honest lately and I just need to say a few things. I did the coal walk! Just, I did it! Michael, you couldn't even do that.  Maybe I should be your boss? Wow, I feel really good right now.  Why didn't any of you come to my art show? I invited all of you.  That really sucked. It's like sometimes some of you act like I don't even exist.  [turns and looks directly at Jim] Jim, I called off my wedding because of you. And now we're not even friends.  And things are just like weird between us, and that sucks. And I miss you. You were my best friend before you went to Stamford, and I really miss you. I shouldn't have been with Roy. And there were a lot of reasons to call off my wedding. But the truth is, I didn't care about any of those reasons until I met you.  And now you're with someone else. And that's... fine. It's... whatever. That's not what... I'm not... Okay, my feet really hurt. The thing that I'm just trying to say to you, Jim... and to everyone else in this circle I guess, is that I miss having fun with you. Just you, not everyone in the circle. Okay, I am going to go walk in the water now. Yeah. It's a good day.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Pam, that was amazing. But I am still looking for someone with a sales background.

quotes.speaker: Group
quotes.text: Flintstones, meet the Flintstones.  They're a modern stone-age family. Ba-ba-da-da-da.  From the town of Bedrock, they're a page right out of history. Ba-da-da-da-da. [overlapping singing of the wrong verses] When you're with the Flintstones, have a yabba-dabba-doo time, a dabba-doo time, we'll have a gay old time!

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: WWWWIIIILLLLMMMMAAAA!

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Nice!

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: So we have about an hour and a half. I suggest that you all go potty now and then we will be congregating on the party bus. Fun on wheels. Only way to travel. Besides a monorail.

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.text: Well, Bob was going to just drive me.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: No. No, no, no. No guests today. Classic gang only. Just us good friends, and Karen and Andy.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Sometimes Michael gets nostalgic and he talks about the classic gang. That's Michael, me, Jim, Dwight, Angela, Kevin, Oscar, Stanley, Phyllis, Creed, Meredith, Kelly and Ryan. We're a regular Ocean's Eleven.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Jim, David Wallace is calling for you.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Oh, okay. Hello. Hey, David. Sure.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Pam, you broke up with your boyfriend and then kept working together. How did that work out?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: You remember you fired Roy for attacking Jim and I don't talk to him anymore really.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Acrimonious.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: This way to the party bus. Good.

quotes.speaker: Meredith
quotes.text: [Sign says 'No Alcohol, No Loud Talking'] Um, What the hell?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: It's a bus that takes you to a party. Here we go.

quotes.speaker: Meredith
quotes.text: Um, I forgot my...

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Here we go. Come on. Okay, everybody here?

quotes.speaker: All
quotes.text: Yeah!

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Then, Mr. Driver, we are off like a herd of turtles! Johnny Carson. [Meredith runs to catch up to bus with her large drink cup]

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Seat belts fastened, folks. Safety first. Hey what is all this?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Nothing.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: If I guess, will you tell me?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: No.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Please?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: No!

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Is that a sumo suit?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: No.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: I know, we're putting on a play for Japanese investors.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: No, we are not.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Please tell me. I've been so good...

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: You are really annoying me. If you don't knock it off...

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Please.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: ...I'm never gonna tell you anything ever again. Stop it! Stop it! Stop it!

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Please.

quotes.speaker: Meredith
quotes.text: Can we please pull over at the next rest stop?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: No. We're only 10 minutes from the lake.

quotes.speaker: Meredith
quotes.text: Pull over! Pull over! [Meredith uses a bush while all the other passengers look the other way, except Creed]

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Yes, I am choosing my apprentice. Which is why I have modeled all my games after Survivor.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Any questions?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Just one.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Yup.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: The torches are lit.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Yes, for dramatic affect.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: No, Michael, people are blindfolded. That's a hazard.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Very good, Jim. Pam, please note that Jim is very astute. All right, are we ready?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Are you not gonna put out the torches?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Set!

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Okay.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Go!

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.text: I think Jim would be a good boss. Plus he's eye candy. It's OK, Bob... Vance knows he's on my list. Um, George Clooney, Leonardo DiCaprio, Jim, and that British guy that got in trouble with a prostitute.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: It is an honor just to be considered for Michael's job. Honestly. And if I win it, then I will be ordering a pretty sizeable Most Improved Player plaque to put over the hole I punched in the wall.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: [sighs] Okay. Pam, who came out best in the race, in your opinion?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Um, Karen left her blindfold on the longest but she also threw her egg at Jim.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Because he wasn't following the rules.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: I think they were just having fun.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: But they didn't complete their task, Pam! If people can't carry an egg in a spoon, blindfolded, then what does that tell you about how they will be able to manage a sales report, or conduct a business call?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: It tells me nothing.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Exactly. Are you sure you're doing that right? Taking an awfully long time.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: There's 800 of them!

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Okay, all right.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: It's very important that you all try to eat as many hotdogs as you can...

quotes.speaker: Meredith
quotes.text: Hotdogs are really unhealthy.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Son of a bitch. God! Okay. All right you know what? Here we go. On your mark! Get set!

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.text: Is there any mustard?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: No mustard! No mustard! Just... eat it. Eat it, Phyllis. Dip it in the water so it will slide down your gullet more easily.

quotes.speaker: Everyone
quotes.text: That's what she said!

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: No, no, no, no, not that-- just... come on, you guys, let's do it! I'm serious. Who's got the hungry?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: I do!

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Who's got the hungry?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: I do!

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Come on, Ryan...

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Let's go.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Ryan, I want to see you with a hot dog in your mouth. Right now.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Karen and I are having our own contest to see who can eat the most normal amount of tuna salad in an unspecified but very cofortable amount of time. I don't know what to tell you. Right now? Dead heat.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Keep eating tuna, Big Tuna. Loser!

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: He's gonna throw up.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: [Dwight and Stanley are in sumo suits] Ready! Go!

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.text: The guy who sits behind me and the guy who sits across from me are fighting to see who becomes my boss. [laughs]

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: [Dwight knocks Stanley down] Yeah! Yeah! Yeah! Eat sand, you fat, old man!

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: Oh, I'm out of it. Let's face it, the hot dog-eating contest was my best shot.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: Michael, since Andy isn't here, maybe I could be the team captain.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: You? You haven't made a sale.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: I know, but I'd like to give this a try.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Don't try to flirt your way into this. Sometimes you really creep me out.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: [in sumo suit, waves down a car, which swerves around him, runs after it, waving his arms] Wait! [throws sumo hair-hat at the retreating car]

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Andy Bernard is in first place with four hot dogs!  Dwight Schrute is a close second with three and a half!  Here comes Stanley!  Here comes Stanley, with three hot dogs!

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: This is an inflatable sumo suit. [blows] Now, in the olden days, when they wanted to find a guy who could be king, they would have him pull a sword out of a stone.  Well, times have changed. [blows] And it's not even about who is the best sumo wrestler.  It's about who is the best boss.  And I don't even care who wins. [blows] It's how they wrestle in a blow-up suit... [breathes in] that will tell me all I need to know [blows] or how sumo... [collapses]
